DOC.brief_summary: Despite the fact that oral sucrose is the most frequently studied non-pharmacological intervention for procedural pain relief in infants, there is a paucity of data on the minimal effective dose. The aim of this study is to find the minimal effective dose of sucrose to reduce pain during a single venous blood sampling procedure.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Sucrose on Pain Relief During Venous Blood Sampling in Preterm Infants
DOC.criteria: born preterm more than 1000 gram severe intraventricular hemorrhage cerebral malformations other malformations requiring surgery medication that may impair pain expression (opioids, paracetamol, sedatives)
